page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The 12 square kilometre block of which the S.W. corner is{O/S:480070} typical of much of West Essex. The landscape is a pleasant blend of gentle undulation punctuated by small stands of mixed woodland. Annexation of small farms and economic pressures have brought about substantial changes in the countryside. Many hedges have been 'grubbed up' and drainage ditches piped & covered. The resultant huge fields facilitate the intensive mechanised farming dominant in the area. Rural charm & traditions are preserved in the many cottages and farmhouses dating back to Tudor times & earlier. The construction of the M.11, whilst cutting a swathe through good farmland has provided rapid links for agriculturists & commuters which many residents regard as beneficial.
